name: Creamy Healthy Broccoli Soup
recipeIngredient: 1  potato (, peeled and roughly chopped into cubes about 1.5cm / 1/2" cubes)
1  white or brown onion (, roughly diced)
1 cup / 250 ml  milk ((low fat, cow or soy))

recipeInstructions.text: Cut / break broccoli into florets into pieces about half the size of a golf ball. Roughly cut most of the stem, other than the main stem, into thumb size pieces. Discard the main stem, or keep for another use.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut / break broccoli into florets into pieces about half the size of a golf ball. Roughly cut most of the stem, other than the main stem, into thumb size pieces. Discard the main stem, or keep for another use.

recipeInstructions.text: Place all ingredients except milk, salt and pepper in pot, put on lid, bring to boil then turn down heat to medium and let it rapidly simmer for 8 to 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place all ingredients except milk, salt and pepper in pot, put on lid, bring to boil then turn down heat to medium and let it rapidly simmer for 8 to 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove lid, add milk, bring back to boil, then remove from heat and whizz with hand held blender.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove lid, add milk, bring back to boil, then remove from heat and whizz with hand held blender.

recipeInstructions.text: You can thicken the soup by cooking it for longer on the stove on a medium low heat.
recipeInstructions.name: You can thicken the soup by cooking it for longer on the stove on a medium low heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Season to taste with salt and pepper, serve with croutons if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Season to taste with salt and pepper, serve with croutons if desired.

itemListElement.text: Cut stale bread into cubes, lightly spray with olive oil, spread on baking stray and bake for 3 to 5 minutes. Sprinkle with salt then top on soup.
itemListElement.name: Cut stale bread into cubes, lightly spray with olive oil, spread on baking stray and bake for 3 to 5 minutes. Sprinkle with salt then top on soup.

review.reviewBody: This is seriously THE best soup I have ever made! Yumyumyum!
WOWSER. Low calorie and creamy delicious. fast and easy. This is now on repeat in our household. Thank you Nagi
Oh boy, this is good! I did cheat a bit and added about 1/4 cup of shredded parmesan at the end (because.. cheese). Superb on a cold Melbourne day!

What to cook when you find perfect farm fresh broccoli at 4 good sized heads for $2 AND your trying to lose weight!

Tastes great- silky texture

Leftovers are perfect for small “hunger buster” serves between meals.
Possibly the easiest and most delicious of all your beautiful soups.
In lurve!! i made this and it came out to be 4 serves (not sure about the grams, just in bowls) - great low calorie option, thank you!!!
So tasty with the cheese and cream, loved it!
sprinkled with cheese and was lovely, very easy to make. Thank you!
This recipe was recommended by a friend a great fan of yours made it yesterday delicious will definitely make it again

This has the WOW factor!

So absolutely delish and so easy to make.

Just added some chilli flakes for some zing.

Thanks again Nagi.
